name: Tomato (Cherry)
chicago_notes: Start indoors 6-8 weeks before last frost (mid-May in Chicago). Transplant after danger of frost. Heat-loving plant.

name: Basil
chicago_notes: Plant after last frost when soil is warm. Loves Chicago's hot summers. Pinch flowers for bushier growth.

name: Lettuce (Leaf)
chicago_notes: Cool season crop. Direct sow in early spring and late summer. Bolt-resistant varieties work best in Chicago heat.

name: Marigold
chicago_notes: Plant after last frost. Excellent pest deterrent. Thrives in Chicago summers.

name: Jalapeno
chicago_notes: Start indoors 8-10 weeks before last frost. Needs warm soil and full sun. Productive in Chicago's hot summers.

name: Lacinato Kale
chicago_notes: Cold hardy! Direct sow or transplant. Flavor improves after frost. Great for Chicago fall gardens.

name: Plum Tomato
chicago_notes: Start indoors 6-8 weeks before last frost. Great for sauce and canning. Determinate variety works well in Chicago.
